messages.subject: October 22 down through history...
messages.msgSnippet: 1951 -- US: Homework Done? 5,000 U.S. soldiers were deliberately exposed to radioactive fallout from nuclear weapons tests in Nevada for study purposes. 1962
messages.messageBody:
1951 -- US: Homework Done? 5,000 U.S. soldiers were
deliberately exposed to radioactive fallout from nuclear
weapons tests in Nevada for study purposes.


1962 -- Nelson Mandela's treason trial begins.

Any man or institution that tries to rob me of my dignity will lose.

Â— Nelson Mandela

1964 -- Nobel Prize for Literature refused by Jean-Paul Sartre,
saying "A writer must refuse to allow himself to be transformed
into an institution."

[I hope JK Roling is reading this]

Peggy
